pros: They're flexible and try to suit teachers' preference of subject, age and level. They maintain strong positive relationships with staff and students. Nice family atmosphere.
cons: They can't predict how many hours will be available in the following year. This company is a sixth form college and seems to get mixed up with a completely different MPW in Glassdoor reviews so readers should take care to understand which company is being reviewed for 'mpw'.
Pressure and workload can sometimes be unbearable.

job_title: Director of Studies in Cambridge, England
pros: Not boring, very busy, lots of variety, great colleagues and students. Rewarding.
cons: Salary is too low. Too busy at times.

review_title: Great chance to learn but no incentive to stay
job_title: Director of Studies in London, England
pros: Get exposure to various aspects to learning in the independent centre. A lot of responsibility and a fast-paced environment.
cons: Unnecessarily long hours and inflexibility. This job is not suitable for people with young families.
Relative low pay / low control of number of hours

review_title: A lovely, supportive and professional place to work. The quality of the education we offer our students is outstanding.
pros: Professional, honest organisation which values it's staff. Many members of staff have been here for 20 or 30 years. Very uncommon in the independant school sector.
cons: Depending on the role, there are some periods of higher workload. In my role it certainly helps to anticipate these and plan ahead. That said, management is extreamely supportive and recognise where you have one above and beyond.

job_title: IT Service Desk Team Leader in London, England
pros: As a private small-size school it gave us the possibility to get exposed on technology at various degree of depth.
cons: The small size can also be a big downside
